DISCLOSURE_INFO:
{
  "Allegations" : "THE CLIENTS ALLEGED THE ADVISOR SOLD THEM VARIABLE UNIVERSAL LIFE INSURANCE POLICIES IN MARCH 2002 WITHOUT DISCLOSING THE SURRENDER PENALTY SCHEDULES. THEY ALSO CLAIMED HIS RECOMMENDATION WAS BASED ON 11% MARKET RETURNS AND HE DID NOT CONSIDER THEIR LARGE MORTGAGE PAYMENTS WHEN DETERMINING HOW MUCH THEY COULD AFFORD IN PREMIUMS. THEY ALSO CLAIMED HE FAILED TO DISCLOSE THE AMOUNTS COVERED UNDER DISABILITY INSURANCE. THEY REQUESTED A REFUND OF ALL PREMIUMS.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$17,000.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "OUR REVIEW FOUND THE ADVISOR PROVIDED POLICY ILLUSTRATIONS TO THE CLIENTS WHICH CLEARLY DETAILED SURRENDER CHARGES AND MINIMUM NO LAPSE PREMIUM AMOUNTS. THE ILLUSTRATIONS ALSO SHOWED A HYPOTHETICAL POLICY VALUES BASED ON 0% AND 11% RETURNS. THE CLIENTS SIGNED AND DATED THE ILLUSTRATIONS. BASED ON THIS INFORMATION, WE FOUND NO EVIDENCE TO SUPPORT THEIR CLAIM THAT THEY DID NOT RECEIVE FULL AND FAIR DISCLOSURE REGARDING POLICY FEATURES. THE CLIENTS COULD HAVE MAINTAINED COVERAGE WITH REDUCED PREMIUMS, BUT THEY OPTED TO CANCEL THE POLICIES INSTEAD. FINALLY, THE CLIENTS MISTAKENLY BELIEVED THEY COULD NOT RECEIVE DISABILITY INSURANCE COVERAGE IN ADDITION TO THEIR POLICIES THROUGH WORK."
}

{
  "Allegations" : "THE CUSTOMERS ALLEGED THE REGISTERED REPRESENTATIVE'S FINANCIAL ADVISOR RESULTED IN A 10,000.00 LOSS IN VALUE BETWEEN MAY 16, 2002 AND AUGUST 15, 2002. ADDITIONALLY, THEY CLAIMED AN ACCOUNT WAS NOT ESTABLISHED FOR THEIR DAUGHTER.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$10,000.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$2,035.07",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "THE FIRM'S REVIEW FOUND IN AUGUST 2002 CUSTOMER EXPRESSED CONCERNS WITH HER PORTFOLIO'S PERFORMANCE. THEREFORE, I RECOMMENDED RE-BALANCING HER IRA TO ADDRESS HER GOAL OF CAPITAL PRESERVATION. THE CHANGES WERE AUTHORIZED ON 06/04/2002, HOWEVER, THERE WERE NOT PROCESSED UNTIL 07/10/2002. CUSTOMER WAS REIMBURSED $526.31 FOR THE DIFFERENCE IN VALUE. ADDITIONALLY, IN THE INTEREST OF GOOD CLIENT RELATIONS SHE WAS REIMBURSED FOR THE $1483.76 CONTINGENT DEFERRED SALES CHARGE THAT WAS ASSESSED WHEN SHE LIQUIDATED HER ACCOUNTS. THE CESA ACCOUNT WAS NOT SET UP SINCE INCOMPLETE INFORMATION WAS SUBMITTED TO THE CORPORATE OFFICE. THE CLIENT WAS REIMBURSED $25.00 FOR LOST INTEREST."
}
